Timeless classic, a game that left a tremendous impact on the industry. There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said about Half-Life. I will say though, that if you are a newcomer to this game, prepare for hell. Later sections of the game can be brutally challenging if you aren't accustomed to Half-Life's quirks. Oh, and Xen is a miserable time but thematically it's very cool so I give it a pass.

I have to admit, I dissed this game when I first played it. For context, I played this game long after it came out, and I was only 14 when I first played it. I thought it was just overhyped late 90's shlock that only people in their 30's played and lusted for out of only nostalgia. After playing it multiple times recently, I couldn't have been more wrong; this absolutely belongs with the greats of DOOM and Quake. The shooting feels satisfying, if a little bit clunky. The story, while sparsely explained, is still ever present throughout the entire game through its environment, rather than exposition dumps (though they're still here, but not frequently). The atmosphere, for a late 90's shooter, is really good, if all be a bit primitive compared to its successors. Regardless, its something everyone should play atleast once, along with its remake, Black Mesa.

Game is really fun at times, however there is a lot of bs parts in the game that drag down the experience. Some parts are easy, some are way too hard and oftentimes I had to use a walkthrough to navigate myself. Combat is fun, but difficulty and some obscure puzzles bring this game down.
Very cool. Nice story and gameplay.

If you're all for classics and getting that sense of nostalgia, go for it! If you're like me who likes more fast paced things with variation, I would not recommend Half-Life 1, and would go for 2 or various episodes. 

There are many ups and downs of Half-Life 1 including but no limited to


Classic
Engagements are always fun
Good story
Challenging
Most chapters are relatively fun

Very very very very long
Areas between engagements can be very boring 
Some chapters are hard to get through
VERY linear game
The entirety of the Xen part

But the biggest elephant in the room for the game...

A GIANT BLOATED NUT SACK BOSS FIGHT LIKE SERIOUSLY WTF

If you want a classic experience, buy Half-Life 1 or Half-Life: Source (Please don't buy HL:S for anything other than mounting it to GMOD, it is very buggy, earlier versions less so)

If you want an experience more like Half-Life 2, buy the remake of HL1; Black Mesa.
